summary.para: Obtains an IEnumGUID interface that enumerates all categories to which the specified GUID belongs.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains a GUID value that identifies the item to enumerate the categories for.

param.name: ppEnum
param.para: Pointer to an IEnumGUID interface pointer that receives the enumerator.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: There is insufficient memory to perform the operation.

summary.para: Obtains an IEnumGUID interface that enumerates all GUIDs included in the specified category.

param.name: rcatid
param.para: Contains a GUID value that identifies the category to enumerate the items for.

param.name: ppEnum
param.para: Pointer to an IEnumGUID interface pointer that receives the enumerator.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: There is insufficient memory to perform the operation.

summary.para: Finds the category closest to the specified GUID from a list of categories.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Specifies the address of the GUID for which to find the closest category.

param.name: pcatid
param.para: Pointer to the GUID that receives the CATID for the closest category.

param.name: ppcatidList
param.para: Pointer to a pointer that specifies an array of CATIDs to search for the closest category.

param.name: ulCount
param.para: Specifies the number of elements in the array of the ppcatidList parameter.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method obtained the closest category from the list of categories, or the method was unable to obtain a category from the list and indicates this with a pcatid parameter pointer to GUID_NULL.
The method was unable to find a category for the specified GUID and signals this with a pcatid parameter pointer to GUID_NULL.
The method cannot access the internal table.
The specified pcatid parameter was NULL on input, or the list of categories contained a NULL element when the ulCount parameter was nonzero.
There is insufficient memory to perform the operation.

remarks.para: The closest category to a GUID is chosen in one of two modes. In the first mode, the method receives a non-empty category list. It chooses the first matching CATID from that list or GUID_NULL if the list does not contain a category that contains the GUID . In the second mode, it receives an empty category list. It chooses the first category that contains the GUID or GUID_NULL if no category contains the GUID .

summary.para: Obtains a GUID from the internal table using its atom.

param.name: guidatom
param.para: Contains a TfGuidAtom value that specifies the GUID to obtain.

param.name: pguid
param.para: Pointer to a GUID value that receives the GUID for the specified atom. Receives GUID_NULL if the GUID for the atom cannot be found.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Obtains the description of the specified GUID from the Windows registry.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Specifies the GUID to obtain the description for.

param.name: pbstrDesc
param.para: Pointer to a BSTR value that receives the description string. Allocate using SysAllocString. The caller must free this memory using SysFreeString when it is no longer required.
Pointer to a BSTR value that receives the description string. This must be allocated using SysAllocString. The caller must free this memory using SysFreeString when it is no longer required.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method cannot obtain the description.

summary.para: Obtains the DWORD value of the specified GUID from the Windows registry.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Specifies the address of the GUID for which to get the value.

param.name: pdw
param.para: Pointer to the DWORD variable that receives the value of the GUID.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was unable to get the DWORD value.
The specified pdw parameter was NULL on input.

summary.para: Determines whether the specified atom represents the specified GUID in the internal table.

param.name: guidatom
param.para: Specifies an atom that represents a GUID in the internal table.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Specifies the address of the GUID to compare with the atom in the internal table.

param.name: pfEqual
param.para: Pointer to a Boolean variable that receives an indication of whether the atom represents the GUID.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method cannot access the internal table.
The specified pfEqual parameter was NULL on input.

remarks.para: If the atom specified by the guidatom parameter represents the GUID specified by the rguid parameter, the pfEqual parameter receives a nonzero value. Otherwise, the pfEqual parameter receives zero.

summary.para: Adds a specified GUID to the specified category in the Windows registry.

param.name: rclsid
param.para: Contains the CLSID of the text service that owns the item.

param.name: rcatid
param.para: Contains a GUID value that identifies the category to register the item under. This can be a user-defined category or one of the predefined category values.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains a GUID value that identifies the item to register.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Adds a GUID to the internal table and obtains an atom for the GUID.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains the GUID to obtain the identifier for.

param.name: pguidatom
param.para: Pointer to a TfGuidAtom value that receives the identifier of the GUID.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: Identical GUID values receive identical TfGuidAtom values.
A TfGuidAtom value is only valid within the process that ITfCategoryMgr.RegisterGUID is called from.

summary.para: Enters a description for a GUID previously registered in the Windows registry.

param.name: rclsid
param.para: Contains the CLSID of the text service that owns the GUID.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains the GUID that the description is registered for.

param.name: pchDesc
param.para: Pointer to a WCHAR buffer that contains the description for the GUID.

param.name: cch
param.para: Contains the length, in characters, of the description string.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was unable to register the description string.

summary.para: Enters a DWORD value for a GUID previously registered in the Windows registry.

param.name: rclsid
param.para: Contains the CLSID of the text service that owns the GUID.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains the GUID that the DWORD is registered for.

param.name: dw
param.para: Contains the DWORD value registered for the GUID.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The method was unable to register the DWORD value.

summary.para: Removes a specified GUID from the specified category in the Windows registry.

param.name: rclsid
param.para: Contains the CLSID of the text service that owns the item.

param.name: rcatid
param.para: Contains a GUID that identifies the category that the item is registered under.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains a GUID that identifies the item to remove.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Removes the description for a GUID from the Windows registry.

param.name: rclsid
param.para: Contains the CLSID of the text service that owns the GUID.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains the GUID that the description is removed for.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: Removes the DWORD value for a GUID from the Windows registry.

param.name: rclsid
param.para: Contains the CLSID of the text service that owns the GUID.

param.name: rguid
param.para: Contains the GUID that the DWORD is removed for.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: The ITfCategoryMgr interface manages categories of objects for text services. The TSF manager implements this interface.

TSF categories help organize objects identified by a globally unique identifier ( GUID ). For example, a class identifier ( CLSID ) identifies a text service, and a GUID identifies the TSF compartment, TSF properties, and TSF display attributes. To group and organize multiple GUIDs, TSF uses category identifiers ( CATIDs).

The category manager uses an internal table, accessed with keys called GUID atoms to cache the GUIDs. Access to GUIDs is efficient using these atoms. When a GUID is obtained using its atom, the GUID description and value can be obtained from the Windows registry.
